unnormalised: Tomato prices are soaring in Delhi! You won't believe this, but they're selling for Rs. 120/kg at the Azadpur Mandi as of 15/07/2024. Traders are blaming the monsoon and supply chain disruptions. My god! That's nearly double what they cost last month. My wife was complaining this morning itself.
normalised: Tomato prices are soaring in Delhi! You won't believe this, but they're selling for rupees one hundred and twenty per kilogram at the Azadpur Mandi as of fifteenth july two thousand and twenty four. Traders are blaming the monsoon and supply chain disruptions. My god! That's nearly double what they cost last month. My wife was complaining this morning itself.

unnormalised: Remember those days when onions were the villains? Now they're comparatively a steal at Rs. 30/kg. But who wants onions when the tadka needs tomatoes, right? It's all gone haywire this year. And the 'aloo' is reasonable at ₹20 per kilo, thank God.
normalised: Remember those days when onions were the villains? Now they're comparatively a steal at rupees thirty per kilogram. But who wants onions when the tadka needs tomatoes, right? It's all gone haywire this year. And the 'aloo' is reasonable at rupees twenty per kilo, thank God.

unnormalised: Even the usually stable 'doodh' (milk) prices have seen a slight nudge. Amul has increased by ₹2 per litre last week. Not major, but it adds up, no? Every paisa counts these days, especially for those of us with big families.
normalised: Even the usually stable 'doodh' (milk) prices have seen a slight nudge. Amul has increased by rupees two per liter last week. Not major, but it adds up, no? Every paisa counts these days, especially for those of us with big families.

unnormalised: 'Dal' prices too! Arhar dal is now crossing Rs. 150/kg. What to cook now? My mother is always saying "eat healthy" but where to get healthy when everything is sky high? Makes you want to just order Maggi everyday.
normalised: 'Dal' prices too! Arhar dal is now crossing rupees one hundred and fifty per kilogram. What to cook now? My mother is always saying "eat healthy" but where to get healthy when everything is sky high? Makes you want to just order Maggi everyday.

unnormalised: Grocers in smaller markets are saying to expect prices to rise further by the end of the month. I saw some at Lajpat Nagar Market selling at 140 rupees for every 1000 grams. One grocer told me that this is because of low stock due to the heavy rains this week. He stated that he had to pay extra for the goods to be transported from the farm at a cost of 150 rupees per crate. He mentioned that he had a bad week with his crates getting wet and losing 10 kilos of onions.
normalised: Grocers in smaller markets are saying to expect prices to rise further by the end of the month. I saw some at Lajpat Nagar Market selling at one hundred and forty rupees for every one thousand grams. One grocer told me that this is because of low stock due to the heavy rains this week. He stated that he had to pay extra for the goods to be transported from the farm at a cost of one hundred and fifty rupees per crate. He mentioned that he had a bad week with his crates getting wet and losing ten kilos of onions.

unnormalised: And if you're thinking of stocking up, forget it! Most of the vendors are rationing what they sell because they don't know how much the new stock is going to cost. Some have put up 'no sale' signs for tomatoes until 17/07/2024.
normalised: And if you're thinking of stocking up, forget it! Most of the vendors are rationing what they sell because they don't know how much the new stock is going to cost. Some have put up 'no sale' signs for tomatoes until seventeenth july two thousand and twenty four.

unnormalised: Consumers are naturally angry. Everyone is feeling the pinch, especially with other expenses going up. A lot of people are saying we need government intervention to curb these price rises. We need more than just politicians giving speeches. Maybe a subsidy is needed for basic groceries like tomatoes, 'aloo', and onions.
normalised: Consumers are naturally angry. Everyone is feeling the pinch, especially with other expenses going up. Maybe a subsidy is needed for basic groceries like tomatoes, 'aloo', and onions.
